questions.label: Warehouse
questions.prompt: Which warehouse should this hotel belong to? (YPR – Malleshwaram / JPN – JP Nagar)
questions.reasoning: Determines which facility handles the logistics and operations for this account: YPR is the Malleshwaram warehouse and JPN is the JP Nagar warehouse.

questions.label: Hotel name
questions.reasoning: Official property name shown in all internal tools, invoices and operational reports. This is the anchor identity we use everywhere when talking about this hotel.

questions.label: Contact phone
questions.reasoning: Primary phone number for the hotel’s on-ground operations team or front office. Used for urgent escalations, delivery coordination and service issues when something breaks in day-to-day operations.

questions.label: Contact email
questions.reasoning: Shared hotel-level email (front office, accounts or owner) used for sending invoices, performance reports, service notifications and any written communication that should be reusable over time.

questions.label: Hotel status
questions.reasoning: Controls whether the hotel is live for billing, pickups and deliveries in our system. Inactive hotels are fully configured but excluded from day-to-day operations and invoice generation.

questions.label: Customer type
questions.reasoning: Classifies what kind of institution this is (hotel, hospital, restaurant, corporate, other). Used to drive pricing patterns, reporting cuts and any business rules that differ by customer category.

questions.label: GSTIN number
questions.reasoning: Legal GST registration number of the customer entity. Mandatory for GST compliant invoicing, filings and for matching this account with statutory records during audits.

questions.label: PAN number
questions.reasoning: PAN of the legal entity that signs the agreement. Used for income tax records, TDS handling and linking invoices, collections and payouts to the correct legal entity.

questions.label: Billing address line 1
questions.reasoning: First line of the legal billing address for this customer. Appears on all invoices, statements and legal documents and is used to determine where the customer is legally located for billing.

questions.label: Billing address line 2
questions.prompt: Billing address: address line 2? (optional — type skip to leave empty)
questions.reasoning: Optional second line of the billing address for building names, landmarks or floor information. Helps ensure invoices and any physical communication reach the exact billing location.

questions.label: Billing city
questions.reasoning: City of the billing address. Important for tax logic, regional reporting and understanding which market this customer belongs to.

questions.label: Billing state
questions.reasoning: State of the billing address. Determines whether IGST or SGST/CGST apply and is critical for GST tax calculation, compliance and route-level reporting.

questions.label: Billing ZIP code
questions.reasoning: ZIP or postal code of the billing address. Used by logistics, regional reporting and any physical communication or dispatch to locate the exact billing area.

questions.label: Billing country
questions.reasoning: Country of the billing entity (default India). Important for legal jurisdiction, international tax treatment and deciding if any cross-border rules apply.

questions.label: Shipping same as billing
questions.prompt: Is the shipping address the same as billing? (yes/no)
questions.reasoning: Indicates whether the place where we ship and pick up linen is exactly the same as the legal billing address. When yes, we can safely reuse billing details and simplify data entry and routing.

questions.label: Shipping address line 1
questions.reasoning: First line of the actual linen delivery and pickup location. Used by operations and routing teams to know exactly where vehicles should go for day-to-day service.

questions.label: Shipping address line 2
questions.prompt: Shipping address: address line 2? (optional — type skip to leave empty)
questions.reasoning: Optional second line of the shipping address for block, wing, floor or landmark information. Helps delivery teams find the exact service location quickly.

questions.label: Shipping city
questions.reasoning: City where linen is delivered and picked up. Used for route clustering, service region planning and understanding which operational hub should serve this property.

questions.label: Shipping state
questions.reasoning: State of the shipping location. Important for any movement related compliance and for understanding how this shipping point fits into our logistics network.

questions.label: Shipping ZIP code
questions.reasoning: ZIP or postal code of the shipping location. Used to plan delivery routes, estimate travel times and group nearby customers for operational efficiency.

questions.label: Shipping country
questions.reasoning: Country of the shipping location (default India). Relevant for international shipping rules and any operational decisions that differ by country.

questions.label: Primary contact name
questions.prompt: Who’s the primary contact person’s name?
questions.reasoning: Full name of the primary operational contact at the hotel (housekeeping head, manager or similar). This is the person we speak to when something needs attention on a day-to-day basis.

questions.label: Primary contact phone
questions.reasoning: Direct phone number of the primary operational contact. Used for urgent escalations, missed pickups, delays and any real-time coordination needed to keep service smooth.

questions.label: Primary contact email
questions.reasoning: Email address of the primary operational contact. Used for sharing visit summaries, operational alerts and any important communication that should reach the person owning daily linen operations.

questions.label: Agreement type
questions.reasoning: Defines whether we are providing rental linen or only processing the customer’s own linen. This drives how we bill, how inventory is managed and how risks and damages are handled.

questions.label: Service start date
questions.reasoning: Date from which the agreement becomes active operationally. Used as the start point for billing, SLA tracking and revenue recognition.

questions.label: Service end date
questions.reasoning: Planned end date of the current agreement term. Used for renewal planning, forecasting and ensuring we do not continue service beyond the agreed period without an extension.

questions.label: Agreement status
questions.reasoning: Shows whether the commercial agreement is currently active or not. Active means we should serve, bill and schedule; inactive means the account is configured but not in live use.

questions.label: Total rooms
questions.reasoning: Total number of rooms under this agreement. Used to size base inventory, estimate daily volume and sanity-check whether usage and billing patterns look reasonable.

questions.label: Occupancy rate
questions.reasoning: Typical occupancy percentage for the property. Helps forecast how much linen will rotate daily and allows us to plan production loads and capacity more intelligently.

questions.label: Deposit amount
questions.reasoning: Amount of security deposit taken against linen inventory and potential damages. Used by finance to track exposure, refunds and risk on this account.

questions.label: Credit days
questions.reasoning: Agreed credit period in days after invoice generation (for example 15 or 30). Drives due dates, dunning logic and how receivables are tracked for this customer.

questions.label: Linen delivery days
questions.reasoning: High-level pattern for how often we deliver and pick up linen (daily or on alternate days). Used for route design, capacity planning and setting the customer’s expectation on frequency.

questions.label: Service frequency
questions.reasoning: Free-text description for any more detailed schedule or special rules (for example weekend-only service or custom pickup windows) that sit on top of the standard delivery pattern.

questions.label: Billing cycle
questions.reasoning: How often invoices are generated for this agreement (for example every 15 or 30 days). Used by billing to schedule runs and by finance to understand expected cash flow cadence.

questions.label: Billing start day
questions.reasoning: Day of the month on which the billing cycle opens. Together with billing_end_day, defines the exact date window each invoice will cover.

questions.label: Billing end day
questions.reasoning: Day of the month on which the billing cycle closes. Used to cut usage into periods that align with the customer’s accounting preferences.

questions.label: Billing type
questions.reasoning: Defines the billing method (for example fixed monthly charges). Helps the system know how to interpret usage and what pricing logic to apply.

questions.label: Price list items
questions.prompt: Provide price list items as JSON array. Example: [{"product_item":"Bedsheet","quantity":100,"price":12.5,"service_type":"Washing"}]
questions.reasoning: Structured list of every linen item covered by this agreement including product name, quantities, prices and service type. This is the single source of truth for how we convert usage into invoices.

questions.label: Customer user name
questions.reasoning: Name of the end user who will log into the customer portal. Used for greeting, access control and to clearly identify who owns this login on the customer side.

questions.label: Customer user email
questions.reasoning: Email address used as the username for the customer portal. Also used for sending password resets, portal notifications and any account-related communication.

questions.label: Customer user phone
questions.reasoning: Phone number of the portal user. Used for two-factor style verification, urgent follow-ups about portal activity and as an extra contact channel when there are access issues.

questions.label: Customer user password
questions.reasoning: Initial password for the customer portal user. Used only at creation time and should typically be changed by the user; stored and handled following security best practices.

questions.label: Customer user role
questions.reasoning: Role or permission level for this portal user (for example admin, viewer, operations). Drives what screens, actions and data they can access inside the customer portal.

questions.label: Create inventory pool
questions.prompt: Do you want to create a dedicated inventory pool? (yes/no)
questions.reasoning: Captures whether this customer wants a dedicated stock pool or to share from a common pool. This decision affects how we allocate, reserve and track physical linen inventory.

questions.label: Inventory pool name
questions.reasoning: Human-friendly name for the dedicated inventory pool (for example “Hotel A – Pool 1”). Used by operations and inventory control to refer to this pool in day-to-day decisions.

questions.label: Inventory pool description
questions.prompt: Inventory pool: description? (optional — type skip to leave empty)
questions.reasoning: Optional narrative about what this pool is for (for example room linen vs banquet linen). Helps operations understand how this pool should be used and any special handling.

questions.label: Inventory pool products
questions.reasoning: List of product SKUs that belong to this inventory pool. Used to know exactly which items are reserved for this customer and for reconciling stock between warehouse and site.

questions.label: Reservation customer name
questions.reasoning: Name of the customer for whom the inventory is being reserved. Used to tie the reservation back to the commercial agreement and to communicate clearly with the customer team.

questions.label: Reservation type
questions.reasoning: Indicates how tightly inventory is locked for this customer (fixed, flexible or rotational). This drives how much stock can move between customers and how rigid the allocation is.

questions.label: Reservation inventory pool
questions.reasoning: Reference to which inventory pool this reservation draws from. Ensures the right physical stock is tied to this agreement and avoids double-counting inventory.

questions.label: Reservation start date
questions.reasoning: Start date from which this reservation is considered active. Used to track when stock should be available and to align with agreement start dates.

questions.label: Reservation end date
questions.reasoning: End date after which this reservation is no longer guaranteed. Used for freeing up or reallocating stock and for planning renewals.

questions.label: Total quantity
questions.reasoning: Total count of linen items reserved under this reservation. Used by planning and finance to understand exposure, usage capacity and how much stock is locked.

questions.label: Quantity with customer
questions.reasoning: How many reserved items are currently physically at the customer site. Key for tracking shrinkage, losses and balancing stock between customer and distribution center.

questions.label: Quantity with DC
questions.reasoning: How many reserved items are currently at the distribution center. Used together with quantity_with_customer to get a complete picture of where stock is sitting at any point in time.
